lines.text: [first lines]
Children of the night, shut up!
We can go to bed, maybe get in a little quickie.
No. With you, never a quickie. Always a longie.
I never drink wine, and I do not smoke shit.
[Rosenberg approaches Dracula in a restaurant]
The second way to kill a vampire, Count; three silver bullets through the heart!
Jeffrey!
[Jeff shoots Dracula three times]
No, Rosenberg, that is a werewolf
A werewolf? Really? Are you sure?
[Guards start to take him away]

[to the guards]
No harm done! The man's all right! This was for a werewolf! No problem! Calm down! Take it easy! I'm a doctor! I know where I'm going!

[after biting a wino]
What was that maniac drinking? Tastes like the Volga river at low tide!
I'm going out for a bite to drink.
if you don't pay for it, you don't get better.
Look, a check. She paid me everything she owes me. She left me, but she learned something. She's a responsible person, or whatever.
Either you spend the rest of your life in an efficiency apartment with seven dissidents and one toilet, or you gather your aristocratic shit together and split.
Renfield.
Yes, master.
What is an efficiency apartment?
I don't know, master. What's a toilet?
[after Rosenberg has set Dracula's Coffin on Fire]
This is a perfect example of a man taking charge of his own life. And I feel... pretty good!
Without me, Transylvania will be as exciting as Bucharest... on a Monday night.
[repeated line]
I'm a doctor! I know what I'm doing.

[triumphantly]
Well, Count, what do you say to that?
[Pulls out a Star of David]
[Dracula hides his face, then realizes what it is and removes his hands]
I would say, leave Cindy alone and find yourself a nice Jewish girl, Doctor!
Huh?
[looks at star]
Ah shit! It's the other one, isn't it?
I think they're from the government.
How do you know?
They're wearing shoes.
You dirty bat! You bit my mother!
What is your name?
Alexei. Rugalov.
No, Alexei. I bit your mother, and your grandmother.

[reading an American phrase book]
What is this? Copyright 1923? Renfield, you bumbling moron, this book is as out of date as... as I am.
Alvin - I told you to go find your roots, but who told you to drink the water?
You have 30 seconds to tell me where Miss Sondheim is, or...
Or what? You'll eat your lunch in my office?
No-o-o, my lunch will eat you.
I thought you were having fun.
Fun? How would you like to go around looking like a head waiter for 700 years?
Can I get you anything?

[looking around at the mess in Cindy's apartment]
A broom, perhaps?
Eh? Oh, I hate housework. It killed my mother.
So that's where you've been for the last two days, and I thought you were lost.
[speaking of]
Where is he?
He'll be here.
Another fly by night character.
I told you I have a man in here...
*Now* you do.
I heard a rooster crow.
A rooster? In New York *City*?
My name is Dr. Jeffrey Rosenberg, and I want to talk to you about a man who sucks the blood out of people.
A loan shark, eh? What's 's name.

[picking hotel room lock]
Every now and then it sure helps to have a patient doing five to ten for breaking and entering.
We're going to make a hoist.
Heist! Heist, heist.

[calling on a blood bank]
We've come to make a withdrawal. We have a very sick man in the car. He needs blood, desperately.
That's a hearse!
So maybe we're a bit late.
Do you think of me as special?
Yes, of course.
So how can you think of yourself as nothing, when I love you?
You know we can't go in there without a warrant.
If we don't, her immortal soul will be lost forever.
If we do I'll lose my pension.

[to Renfield]
Why did you tell him that?
Because the bad guys always tell the good guys what they're going to do just before they try to kill them.
He's absolutely right, Miss Cindy, that's part of the rules. But in this case, WE are they good guys.
Master, please be careful!
What is it?
You nearly stepped on my dinner!
[a black beetle]
Forgive me. Bon appetit!
The wolf is a very misunderstood creature. He never kills for sport, only what is needed. And he always protects the young... and the old.
Pardon me. Would you like chicken Kiev, Chateaubriand or veal cutlet Florentine for lunch?
Everything you mentioned is dead. Don't you have anything that's alive and kicking?

[scoffs at Renfield]
I'll have the chicken Kiev, miss. Oh, why don't you bring a nice juicy mouse for little Salome here?
Could I have one, too?
[the lady laughs and Renfield laughs with her]
[Rosenberg is about to set Dracula's coffin on fire]
In the name of all the Van Helsings who have ever lived... burn, baby! Burn!
[throws the lit match on the coffin, and the coffin begins to ignite]
[to Dracula and Renfield]
If you two freaks don't get out of here, I AM GOING TO SCREAM MY HEAD OFF!
If you scream loudly, they'll think you where frightened by a mouse.
[Renfield places a live mouse above the opening in the nurse's blouse - the nurse screams and runs out of the room. Renfield laughs]
[a viewing in a funeral home]
I knew Brother Alvin... and he was a swinger!
Yes! Praise the Lord! Praise the Lord! Alleluia! , etc.
He loved his booze, hahahaha. He loved his women.
Yeah! And my wife, too! Yes, he did! Sure did! , etc
But must of all, he loved his Cadillac Saville, and it's a beaute. I know, because he left it to me, Hallelujah!
Praise the Lord! Praise the Lord! , etc

I showed him how God wanted him to have a swell time while he was alive. Because, brothers and sisters, when you is gone, you is gone. And ain't no way , no how, nobody's going to bring you back here once you is dead!
[the coffin's lid rises, and Dracula sits up inside]
Good Evening.
[the mourners scream in panic, and run out of the funeral home, knocking over the chairs]

[to Reverend Mike]
I am Count Dracula. I would like a large suite with a bath. I have a reservation.
[Reverend Mike screams and jumps through the stained glass window, shattering the glass]
This is not the lobby of the Plaza Hotel?
You were born in the wrong time, Cindy Sondheim. In the other age things were simpler, less complicated. Do you remember how many women had nervous breakdowns in the fourteenth century?
No.
Three.
No!
What?
No! It can't be!
What, Jeffrey?
Dracula!
How did you know his name?
[last lines]
Oh, this isn't so hard. I think I'm going to love imortality.
There is one small disadvantage. We can only live by night.
00, anyway.
You and your cockroach-eating friend over there... have 48 hours to get out!Good evening, Comrade Count.
Wait one minute. This is my home. My people cleared the land. We tortured innocent peasants for it. We even murdered for it. By Romanian law, that makes it ours.
Did you have a nice day, my beauty?
Well, Rene ran my ass off all day. I mean, he may be the best photographer in New York City, but he's still a bitch.
Now, now, darling. They have a right to their life.
Yes, I know, Jeffrey. They love in their way, we love in ours, who's to say which is right, by the 21st Century homosexuality will probably be the normal lifestyle.
Excellent.
[Renfield and the Count drive up to a blood bank in a hearse]
You did real well, Renfield.
Thank you, Master.
A combination getaway car and mobile home!
[Renfield opens a refrigerator at the blood bank that's stocked with units of blood]
Master! We hit the jackpot!
Only in America! Plastic disposable bodies! It's like a supermarket!

[to Renfield, holding up a test tube full of blood]
I propose a toast. Here's blood in your eye!
[Rosenberg and the lieutenant arrive at Cindy's apartment building to find Dracula's hearse parked out front]
Look at this! It's *him*!
Yeah... or a rock group!
